intro: Angelica elgonense, commonly known as East African angelica, is a perennial herb native to the highlands of East Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, which bloom in late summer. Angelica elgonense is known for its aromatic roots and stems, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters.
